ys.succinct.util

Interface Rank

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BitVector
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRank, IntRank, SamplingBitVector

    public interface Rank
    An object that supports rank-based operations on the bit set that it wraps. Bit sets of the maximum size Integer.MAX_VALUE can be handled.
    Author:
    Yauheni Shahun

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int excess(int index)
      Gets the difference between the number of 1s and the number of 0s from the beginning and up to the given position (inclusively) in the bit set.
      int rank()
      Gets the total number of 1s in the bit set.
      int rank(int index)
      Gets the number of 1s from the beginning and up to the given position (inclusively) in the bit set.
      int rank0(int index)
      Gets the number of 0s from the beginning and up to the given position (inclusively) in the bit set.

    • Method Detail

      • excess

        int excess(int index)
        Gets the difference between the number of 1s and the number of 0s from the beginning and up to the given position (inclusively) in the bit set.
        Parameters:
        index - the bit position (0-based) in the bit set
        Returns:
        excess value of the bit
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the bit set

      • rank

        int rank(int index)
        Gets the number of 1s from the beginning and up to the given position (inclusively) in the bit set.
        Parameters:
        index - the bit position (0-based) in the bit set
        Returns:
        rank of 1s of the bit
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the bit set

      • rank

        int rank()
        Gets the total number of 1s in the bit set.
        Returns:
        rank of 1s of the bit set

      • rank0

        int rank0(int index)
        Gets the number of 0s from the beginning and up to the given position (inclusively) in the bit set.
        Parameters:
        index - the bit position (0-based) in the bit set
        Returns:
        rank of 0s of the bit
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the size of the bit set
